Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery hydria with root of horizontal handle; exterior: on shoulder, black-figure decoration consisting of parts of two sirens to left (part of tail of one siren with alternate feathers in added red, black and added white; of other siren, legs, part of both wings with red on forepart of wing with row of white dots and body with white stripe on chest and on edge of wing); below, two black bands; below, part of painted black handle zone with traces of handle root. Drilled holes for analysis.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the siren, see UCL 732. Sirens are commonly depicted on vases from the Urla Group.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.13)
